access: Second-mark members of the Firebrands have access to this item.
markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Weapon 0"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Wrist Launcher](/Weapons.aspx?ID=355)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Agile" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=170" />
<trait label="Concealable" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=327" />
<trait label="Free-Hand" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=181" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Firebrands](/Sources.aspx?ID=196) pg. 83</row>

**Access** Second-mark members of the Firebrands have access to this item.

<row gap="medium">
**Price** 3 gp

**Damage** 1d4 P

**Bulk** 1
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Hands** 1

**Range** 30 ft.

**Reload** 1
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Category** Martial

**Group** [Dart](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=6)
</row>

</column>

---

This slender tube is attached to a large strap worn on the forearm. You can fire a dart from the tube with a twist of the wrist. The wrist launcher uses [darts](/Weapons.aspx?ID=68) as ammunition.

<title level="2">Critical Specialization Effects</title>

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 283 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make a Strike with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.

[Click here for the full rules on Critical Specialization Effects](/Rules.aspx?ID=235).

<document level="2" id="weapon-group-6" />
name: Wrist Launcher

You can fire a dart from the tube with a twist of the wrist. The wrist launcher uses darts as ammunition.
